examples: Invite a friend to the party, and have fun (= enjoy yourself)!
Having fun (= are you enjoying yourself)?
We had great fun at the beach.
I really enjoyed your party - it was such good fun.
She's a lot of fun to be with.
Mark was ill for most of the holiday so that took all the fun out of it.
It's no fun/not much fun (= not enjoyable) having to work on Saturdays.
I will always remember her as a fun-loving girl.
"We're going on a picnic this weekend." "What fun (= how enjoyable)!"
The relationship was never going to work, but it was fun while it lasted.
I ran but just for fun.

body_content.explanation: to make a joke about someone or something in a way that is not kind:
examples: The other children were always making fun of him because he was fat and wore glasses.

body_content.explanation: behaviour or activities that are not serious; games or jokes:
examples: The children are always full of fun.
I didn't mean to upset her - it was just a bit of fun.
I didn't mean what I said, it was only in fun (= a joke).

body_content.explanation: giving pleasure, especially because of being not at all serious:
examples: There are lots of fun things to do here.
Did you have a fun evening?
These feather accessories are so fun and unusual.
This is not a very fun topic of discussion.

body_content.explanation: (of a person) enjoyable to be with, especially because of not being serious:
examples: He's a really fun person.
I love my friends as they are so fun and creative.
